task.title: Defining subscriber attributes
task.shortdesc: Define new subscriber attributes to accurately maintain your database.

step.cmd: Click the Subscriber attribute definitions icon.
To add a subscriber attribute definition, click the Add button (+).
Enter a name and description for the subscriber attribute.
In the Execution scope area, select a scope.
(Optional) In the Policy area, check an option:

substep.cmd: Suppress attribute from policy files when unused in policy.
Notify the system when this attribute is set.
Make this attribute reportable by Network Demographics.
Accept any value. Select from the list.
Specified values. Enter a value and click Add.
Add or remove attributes on the list record (contained attribute list).

info.p: A Record attribute contains a group of attributes that can be a mix of any of the simple-types (strings, integers, Booleans and so on). For example, MyRecordAttribute, type 'record' is a list that declares other attributes: MySubString1 type is string mySubString2 type is string someIntAttr type is integer andABoolAttr type is boolean
